para: OOF.NodeSelection.Select_From_Selected_Elements provides three ways of selecting &nodes; based on a pre-existing &elem; selection. The two parameters internal and boundary control which &nodes; will be selected. If internal is True, then the &nodes; that are completely surrounded by selected &elems; will be selected. If boundary is True, then &nodes; that are not completely surrounded by selected &elems; will be selected.

figure.title: Selecting Nodes from the Selected Elements

caption.para: The selected &elems; are shown in red. (a) With boundary=True and internal=False, only the &nodes; (blue dots) on the perimeter of the set of selected &elems; are selected. (b) With boundary=False and internal=True, only the &nodes; in the interior of the &elem; set are selected. (c) With both parameters True all nodes that are part of a selected &elem; are selected.
